result.execSummary:
The defendant Sara L. Goessl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay court costs and DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Seek and obtain and maintain full time employment while on supervision.
No contact with Chase Uebelher without the agent's prior approval.

1 Day Jail credit in the event Defendant comes back on a revocation situation.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken strictly according to the prescription.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Do not associate with any persons Defendant knows possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Have any counseling that the agent recommends that is appropriate, if any.
Comply with any other conditions that may have been imposed on other cases.
If conditions are complete, Court will grant early discharge at discrection of the agent.

Have an AODA assessment unless already have had one within the last 6-9 months.  If one was already done, then Defendant to continue to comply with the treatment recommendations. If not had one, then ordered to have one as a condition of probation supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2.
If conditions are complete, Court will grant early discharge at discretion of the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sara L. Goessl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for Early Discharge from Probation pursuant to 973.09(3)(d)

Defendant Sara L. Goessl in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:23 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea/sentencing this morning.

Court has a plea questionnaire.
There is an agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 2 and Count 3. Count 1 will be dismissed and read in.
Defense is free to argue.

Atty Carroll concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST to Count 2. 
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST to Count 3.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Carroll for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Found Guilty
Count 3: Found Guilty

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court, reviews previous convictions.
Atty Carroll makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests no violent or abusive contact, requests 12 months probation instead of the 24 months the State is recommending.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Placed on probation for a period of 24 Months
1 Day Jail credit in the event Defendant comes back on a revocation situation
Conditions:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken strictly according to the prescription 
Have an AODA assessment unless already have had one within the last 6-9 months.  If one was already done, then Defendant to continue to comply with the treatment recommendations. If not had one, then ordered to have one as a condition of probation supervision
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons Defendant knows possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Seek and obtain and maintain full time employment while on supervision
Have any counseling that the agent recommends that is appropriate, if any
Pay Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
No contact with Chase Uebelher without the agent's prior approval
Comply with any other conditions that may have been imposed on other cases
If conditions are complete, Court will grant early discharge at discrection of the agent

Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Placed on probation for a period fo 24 Months, concurrent to Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
If conditions are complete, Court will grant early discharge at discretion of the agent

11:06 AM Court is in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Sara L. Goessl in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY pleas entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Portage County Community Justice Program/Court Referral Form

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
No contact with Chase Uebelher.

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Battery and Bail Jump.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $2,000 sig bond  with conditions as stated.
Court sets bond.
Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  02-15-16  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
